column1: Remember there is still much to be hopeful for. A number of promising COVID-19 vaccine candidates. A president-elect who has not just the experience to lead our country but the empathy and integrity to go with it (7/10)

Nearly one quarter of American households have experienced food insecurity this year. Senate Republicans: You are failing the American people. Tell Mitch McConnell to pass a comprehensive coronavirus relief package now. https://t.co/DqHMAEqKim

American families need relief NOW. And if Mitch McConnell were serious about passing COVID relief he wouldn’t throw poison pills—like blanket liability protections for businesses that don’t take the lives of their workers seriously—into legislation.  https://t.co/6BCzzblhGD

Our country is seeing 130000 new cases everyday and more than 238000 Americans have died. But rather than work with Democrats to pass a COVID relief package Senator McConnell is focused on coddling President Trump's ego.   Enough is enough. Stop the games. Do your job. https://t.co/gddck5HLmN

Our first and most important priority is COVID relief.   President-Elect Biden is already taking important steps to try to contain this pandemic—and I stand ready in the Senate to write any legislation to help move the right solutions forward. https://t.co/QhjMhpZetk

My Republican colleagues in the Senate need to get their priorities straight and start rushing to get people COVID relief instead of rushing to take health care away from millions of people at the moment they need it most.

Right now Congress is pushing trillions of dollars of COVID relief out the door. And millions are going right into the pockets of the same people making decisions about relief policy. @katieporteroc and I want to put a stop to this. https://t.co/jSjGvhSJvq

Did you know that millions of dollars of COVID relief money went right into the pockets of the same members of Congress who passed it?    @katieporteroc and I are announcing new legislation to end this kind of government abuse: The STOCK Act 2.0   Sign on: https://t.co/OIXd3czADK https://t.co/b4G1hZBESV

We just crossed 200000 COVID deaths. And millions of families are struggling to keep food on the table and pay rent.   But right now Trump is abusing his power to distract the American people from these issues.   We need to vote him out.  https://t.co/JOAbmeQl8u

As much as President Trump and many Republicans want to pretend that COVID has magically gone away it hasn’t.  To act like it has is an affront to the lives lost and the millions of families who have been affected.  It’s also a recipe for disaster.

Nearly 30 million people are out of work.  Tens of thousands are contracting COVID each day.  Millions are struggling to pay rent and keep food on the table.  But instead of addressing these needs McConnell has put out a relief bill that prioritizes the needs of corporations.

This #LaborDay I’m thinking of the essential workers who remain at the frontlines of our country’s response to the COVID crisis. They deserve meaningful protections from Congress—including premium compensation paid sick and family leave and health and safety protections.

Betsy DeVos wants to fully reopen schools without any concrete plan to do so safely despite the rising number of COVID-19 cases across the country.   This is inept leadership at best malfeasance at worst. https://t.co/mvmcyid9Ec

We’re seeing a resurgence in COVID19 spread across the country as people stop practicing social distancing and stop wearing masks.   Each of us has a duty to protect others.   Take precaution and wear a mask. https://t.co/OGKJF4qdy2

The COVID-19 crisis has left state and local governments facing rising costs and plummeting revenues. If the Senate doesn’t act soon to help things stand to get very bad very soon. It’s time to get back to work and give them direct federal relief.

Over 1.7 million cases of COVID-19 in the country.   Over 100000 dead.   Now Trump is further undermining our leadership and putting the American people at risk by severing ties with the @WHO the organization coordinating international response and drug trials. https://t.co/q1PpSPpb2U

The country is rapidly approaching 100000 deaths due to COVID-19. Millions are out of work.   Americans need more relief but why does McConnell have the Senate back in session? To confirm Trump’s far-right judicial nominees.   We deserve better. https://t.co/Q3uSw31SHh https://t.co/tHfrSOuhag

Our first responders are serving on the front lines of this pandemic risking their health to keep us safe. I'm proud to have pushed for the passage of legislation to support the families of public safety officers lost to COVID-19.  https://t.co/av8PUQXCHE

More than 30 million Americans have lost their jobs in the wake of the coronavirus outbreak. We need to ensure that they not only return to the workplace but that the workplace they return to offers them more opportunity and stability. I wrote more here: https://t.co/X7fdhsYIDr

If we want to safely re-open our country we need to strengthen our nation’s public health system and our testing and contact-tracing capacity. That’s why I introduced legislation to build a Health Force to recruit Americans for jobs at the frontlines of the coronavirus crisis.

Tomorrow: I'm joining a national call with Women for Biden 5/7 @ 7PM ET. We'll discuss what's at stake this election the issues women are facing during the COVID crisis and why @JoeBiden would be the strongest advocate for women across the country.   https://t.co/JCNCoiVSdC

Looking forward to joining @Will_P_Goodwin of @votevets for an Instagram live tomorrow 5/7. We'll discuss the fight against COVID-19 and what it means for our service members and veterans. Be sure to join us: https://t.co/3lMKOrzSgg https://t.co/wnJXe6087C

At this moment nurses are hard at work providing critical health care on the front lines of this COVID crisis. Make sure to thank them today and remember that our gratitude isn't enough—we must keep speaking out for the protections PPE and pay they deserve. #NationalNursesDay

Numerous experts have said that our country’s testing capacity is inadequate and far from what is needed to contain the coronavirus outbreak. It’s time for real leadership from President Trump. The health of our nation depends on a comprehensive national testing strategy.

TODAY @ 1PM ET: I'm joining @runforsomething for a panel called "Quaranteam" where @jessicaramos @RuiXuKS and @RepJosieRaymond and I will discuss parenting and legislating during COVID-19. It's sure to be a great conversation!   Don't miss it: https://t.co/d8ubonYto9 https://t.co/dpU9TYTozu

With the USPS facing the twin threats of the COVID-19 pandemic and a president who wants to hasten its demise we must put all our effort toward strengthening this American institution.  My solution? Postal banking and universal vote-by-mail. https://t.co/0yJ6tJEJbZ

Mitch McConnell just told states suffering from the coronavirus pandemic that they should go bankrupt.   That's not the kind of leadership we deserve.   It's time to retire Mitch and send @AmyMcGrathKY to the Senate. The stakes couldn't be higher:   https://t.co/XEOtm4DhsX

By establishing a Health Force to recruit and train Americans to combat the coronavirus we can put thousands back to work and meet our most urgent public health needs. I’m excited to partner with @MichaelBennet on an innovative approach to respond to this unprecedented crisis. https://t.co/ybqytLkgqh

Even before this public health crisis fewer than 20% of American workers had access to paid leave. By making it available to every American worker we can alleviate fears care for working families and help slow the spread of coronavirus.

The end to the COVID-19 crisis is still months away but it’s clear that in the aftermath it will call for bold transformational legislation: America’s first universal paid family and medical leave policy. I share more in @TIME: https://t.co/nvza0pwl3S

Really appreciate you taking part in the #CombatCOVID19Challenge @DavidChang! And so grateful for all that you're doing right now to help the restaurant industry at this critical time. https://t.co/MJfJAj3a5s

Farmers are doing important work to keep food on Americans' tables but the coronavirus outbreak has only deepened their insurmountable debt. We must give our country's small farms the urgent direct relief needed to ensure that they can keep going.  https://t.co/afhQi3qNJ9
Challenging my friends @CoryBooker @KathyHochul and @davidchang to take part! #CombatCOVID19Challenge

Acts of kindness and compassion are more important than ever especially for essential workers on the front lines of this crisis. So today I’m excited to launch the #CombatCOVID19Challenge to encourage more people to support their communities at this critical time. Learn more: https://t.co/b69a4217aU

On Wednesday 4/15 at 4pm ET I'm joining @generator_coll for a live discussion with the amazing @ilazer about the federal response to COVID19 and what New Yorkers can do to navigate this pandemic. Hope to see you there! Tune in on YouTube: https://t.co/UvT7YvmuzB https://t.co/O8Q4TWo3Os

Right now millions are being forced to choose between earning a paycheck or protecting society with many showing up sick to work because they have no other choice. It’s clear that we must have comprehensive paid family and sick leave to help slow the spread of coronavirus.

I’m so proud of the 22 @UpstateNews nurses who are heading from Syracuse to @stonybrooku hospital today to help in the fight against #COVID19. Thank you for your service and for your bravery. https://t.co/1wvYSP7Zhi

As we come off the heels of another tough week I want to take another moment to recognize the health care workers first responders and other essential workers at the front lines of the fight against COVID-19. Thanks for all that you do and sending love and strength. https://t.co/cbcGBbp8jv

Capt. Crozier was trying to protect his command from coronavirus. He was fulfilling his duty. There needs to be a thorough investigation by the Inspector General into this case—and the Navy's preparedness for such a public health crisis.   https://t.co/C6UxzpOnxZ

Right now New York is the epicenter of the coronavirus outbreak. The president must be transparent about why New York's requests for medical supplies remain unfulfilled while others reportedly have had their requests fulfilled completely. https://t.co/LFAe0b2rkr
The coronavirus economic relief package that was just signed into law will get real money into the hands of real people. https://t.co/S379hXOO1Y

I spoke with @BrianLehrer this morning to discuss the coronavirus relief package as well as our efforts to aid survivors of domestic violence during this crisis. I answered a few questions from New Yorkers as well. Listen to our conversation: https://t.co/nNp4D0afvE

I voted against advancing the Senate Republican #COVID19 stimulus plan. It's a shameful piece of legislation. In the midst of this unprecedented crisis we have to ensure that this package is fair and equitable—and I will keep fighting to do that.

Sen. McConnell is using what should be a moment of bipartisan leadership to pay back his campaign donors with a corporate slush fund with no transparency or accountability. As it stands his #COVID19 stimulus plan makes the 2008 bank bailout look responsible. It’s so bad.

Today every Senate Dem supported the PAID Leave Act—my bill with @PattyMurray to give emergency paid family and sick leave to every worker—as an amendment to the coronavirus relief package. The House majority supports this too. This is a must include provision moving forward.

To fight this crisis we must slow the spread of the coronavirus. That means providing paid sick days and paid family leave to every American worker now. No exceptions or carve outs—especially not for the wealthiest companies in the world.

The #COVID19 outbreak has made clear again that we must do more to support our working families. Today @PattyMurray @rosadelauro and I are introducing the PAID Leave Act—a comprehensive emergency paid sick and family leave bill to help workers confront this and future crises.

I want to remind everyone that the best way to help slow the spread of #COVID19 is to stay home (if you’re able) and to practice social distancing as much as possible—even if you’re healthy or not showing symptoms. We’ll all be safer if we all take precautions. https://t.co/CVWJFKh2vJ

Imagine how different this #COVID19 crisis would be if every single worker knew they could care themselves or a loved one if they’re sick. Paid family and sick leave would certainly give our workforce the calm and confidence needed to get through this. So why not get it done?
For the safety and well-being of our families communities and economy as we address the #COVID19 outbreak Congress must pass paid sick leave for every American worker.

Let's all take a moment today to thank the nation's health care workers who are on the front lines of the #COVID19 response. We see you we're grateful for your commitment to public health and we'll speak out to make sure that you are protected too.

#COVID19 isn’t just a public health crisis it’s an economic crisis for the millions of working Americans without paid sick leave.   We must expand paid sick leave. Let's give every worker the time they need to care for themselves.

With the increasing number of cases of coronavirus in New York State I'm urging the federal government to loosen restrictions so that more people can get tested as soon as possible. https://t.co/rLjMFpkpxP

A few times in our lives we've all had to consider whether or not to come to work when feeling under the weather.   With nationwide anxiety over the spread of Coronavirus wouldn't you rather all our workers had decent paid sick leave?   https://t.co/27MfzoCJE8

The severity of the Coronavirus outbreak warrants transparency from the Trump administration. We deserve detailed timelines for testing kits and the development of vaccines—and assurance that our health workforce and first responders will have what they need.

We're being told "not if but when." We need leadership a clear plan and most of all a sense of urgency to handle the spread of the Coronavirus. I have yet to see it from this administration.   https://t.co/ogzAgmnVMG
